page.title: 16POLITICS:WOODTON AREA
page.content: The 4 parishes are in Norfolk C.C.'s Loddon electoral area.In the 1985 elections 48% of the Woodton elector- ate voted at Woodton Village Hall electing a Conservative councillor.In 1984 in the District Council elect- -ions,the parishes elected Conservatives,57.8% of Woodton electorate voted;the polling station- the Village Hall-is,unusually,shared with nearby Bedingham which is in a different Ward. Hempnall & Woodton Peace Group was founded 1980.1/4 of its 60 members live in Woodton.The aim of the group "is to encourage local people to think" about the nuclear question & how best to achieve real peace.To this end leaflets & question- naires are distributed,petitions circulated & public meetings held.In 1985 Lord Melchett spoke to a big audience on "Agriculture & the bomb".
